# Problem 1
```{r}
mean_price <- mean(Carseats$Price)
mean_competitor_price <- mean(Carseats$CompPrice)
target_price <- 110

price_data <- data.frame(
  variable = c("mean_price", "mean_competitor_price", "target_price"),
  price = c(mean_price, mean_competitor_price, target_price)) 

gt(price_data)

ggplot(price_data, aes(x = variable,
                       y = price,
                       fill = variable)) +
  geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Dark2") +
  labs(title = "Price Comparison", x = "Variable", y = "Value") +
  theme_minimal()
```
Hypothesis: The company's claim that the average price of their own seats is $110 is False.

Alternative: $H_a: \mu \ne 100$ 

Although the company's average price of carseats is very close from their claim of `$110`, the actual average price of their car seats is `$116` this is still lower than the average price of their competitors whose average price is `$125`.
